intro: Litchi ramboutan-ake, commonly known as the lychee, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Southeast Asia. It produces fragrant, red-skinned fruits with a white, juicy, seed-filled flesh. The plant has compound leaves with lance-shaped leaflets and produces small, pale yellow flowers. The fruit develops from the flower and is typically harvested when the skin turns a deep red or reddish-brown. The plant thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth.
